com.absio.database

Class DatabaseWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.absio.database.DatabaseWrapper

  • public class DatabaseWrapper
extends Object
    This class wraps a SQL Database. It manages the connection and provides several helper method for executing queries and updates. When dealing with parameters the helper methods use SqlParameter to represent a generic parameter (name and value).

    • Method Detail

      • fetchLocalTime

        public static org.threeten.bp.ZonedDateTime fetchLocalTime(ResultSet resultSet,
                                                           String columnName)
                                                    throws SQLException
        Fetches and converts a Long into a ZonedDateTime from the ResultSet based on a column name.

        NOTE: See toLocalTime(long)

        Parameters:
        resultSet - the result set from the DatabaseWrapper
        columnName - the column name to fetch
        Returns:
        the converted ZonedDateTime or null
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if an error occurs accessing the ResultSet

      • fetchUUID

        public static UUID fetchUUID(ResultSet resultSet,
                             String columnName)
                      throws SQLException
        Fetches and converts a String into a UUID from the ResultSet based on a column name.

        NOTE: See UUID.fromString(String)

        Parameters:
        resultSet - the result set from the DatabaseWrapper
        columnName - the column name to fetch
        Returns:
        the converted UUID or null
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if an error occurs accessing the ResultSet

      • toLocalTime

        public static org.threeten.bp.ZonedDateTime toLocalTime(long secondsSinceEpoch)
        This will take the passed in time (assumed seconds since Epoch in the UTC time zone) and convert to the local time zone.
        Parameters:
        secondsSinceEpoch - the seconds since Epoch in the UTC time zone to convert to local time
        Returns:
        the local time

      • toUTCTimeAsLong

        Get the time represented as a long (seconds since Epoch) and in the UTC time zone.
        Parameters:
        dateTime - the time to convert to a long in UTC
        Returns:
        the time represented as a long

      • close

        public void close()
           throws SQLException
        If the database is open this will close the JDBC Connection.
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue closing the Connection

      • createStatement

        public Statement createStatement()
                          throws SQLException
        Creates a Statement using the JDBC Connection.

        NOTE: the database must be open before you call this method.

        Returns:
        the Statement
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue creating the Statement

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
             throws IOException,
                    SQLException
        This will close the JDBC Connection and then delete the database file.

        NOTE: the database file will be deleted and cannot be recovered!

        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if there was an issue deleting the database file
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue closing the Connection

      • dropTable

        public void dropTable(String tableName)
               throws SQLException
        This will drop the table from the database.

        NOTE: the database must be open before you call this method.

        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table to drop
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue dropping the table

      • executeCountQuery

        public long executeCountQuery(String countSql)
                       throws SQLException
        This will execute the count query and return the result.

        NOTE: the database must be open before you call this method.

        Parameters:
        countSql - the count query to run
        Returns:
        the count
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue executing the count query

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the count
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue executing the count query

      • executeUpdate

        public int executeUpdate(String sql)
                  throws SQLException
        The will execute the given sql as an update (insert, update, delete, etc).

        NOTE: the database must be open before you call this method.

        Parameters:
        sql - the update sql to execute
        Returns:
        the number of rows affected by the execution
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there is an issue executing the update

      • executeUpdateWithParameters

        public int executeUpdateWithParameters(ParameterizedSql parameterizedSql)
                                throws SQLException
        The will execute the given sql as an update with the given parameters (insert, update, delete, etc).

        NOTE: the database must be open before you call this method.

        Parameters:
        parameterizedSql - the update sql to execute and the parameters to use in the execution
        Returns:
        the number of rows affected by the execution
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there is an issue executing the update

      • executeUpdateWithParameters

        public int executeUpdateWithParameters(String sql,
                                       SqlParameter... parameters)
                                throws SQLException

        NOTE: the database must be open before you call this method.

        Parameters:
        sql - the update sql to execute
        parameters - the parameters to use in the execution
        Returns:
        the number of rows affected by the execution
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there is an issue executing the update

      • fillStatement

        public void fillStatement(PreparedStatement statement,
                          SqlParameter... parameters)
                   throws SQLException
        This is a utility method to help fill PreparedStatements (by calling SqlParameter.fillStatement(int, PreparedStatement). This assumes the passed in parameters are in same the order as they are in the PreparedStatement.
        Parameters:
        statement - the statement to fill
        parameters - the parameters to fill the statement with
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if an error occurs filling the statement

      • getColumnNames

        public List<String> getColumnNames(String tableName)
                            throws SQLException
        Gets the names of all the columns of a table.

        NOTE: the database must be open before you call this method.

        Parameters:
        tableName - the table in question
        Returns:
        the column names for the table
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue getting the names of the columns in the database

      • setVersion

        public void setVersion(int version)
                throws SQLException
        Set the version of the database.

        NOTE: the database must be open before you call this method.

        Parameters:
        version - the version of the database
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue setting the version of the database

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Get if the database is open.
        Returns:
        true if the database is open

      • openOrCreate

        public DatabaseOpenState openOrCreate()
                               throws SQLException,
                                      IOException
        Opens a database for operation. If the database file does not exist, it will be created. This will use location for database file and hexEncodedAes256Key as the AES256 HEX encoded key for the database.

        NOTE: the database must be open before you call this method.

        Returns:
        whether the database was newly created (DatabaseOpenState.NEW) or already existed (DatabaseOpenState.EXISTING)
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue creating or opening the database
        IOException - thrown if there was an issue with the database location

      • prepareStatement

        public PreparedStatement prepareStatement(String sql,
                                          SqlParameter... parameters)
                                   throws SQLException
        Create a PreparedStatement for the given sql and fill the parameters.

        NOTE: the database must be open before you call this method.

        Parameters:
        sql - the sql to create a PreparedStatement with
        parameters - the parameters to fill the statement with
        Returns:
        the PreparedStatement
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue creating the PreparedStatement

      • prepareStatement

        public PreparedStatement prepareStatement(ParameterizedSql parameterizedSql)
                                   throws SQLException
        Create a PreparedStatement for the given sql and fill the parameters.

        NOTE: the database must be open before you call this method.

        Parameters:
        parameterizedSql - the sql to create a PreparedStatement with and the parameters to fill the statement with
        Returns:
        the PreparedStatement
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue creating the PreparedStatement

      • tableExists

        public boolean tableExists(String tableName)
                    throws SQLException
        Check if a table exists in the database.

        NOTE: the database must be open before you call this method.

        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table
        Returns:
        true if the table exists in the database
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue checking if the table exists
